column4: im getting segmentation faults.. whats the est approach to fix these?
segfaults shouldn't happen
right I know
there are three possible causes: 1) a bug in the program, 2) your binary being corrupted (reinstall might help) or 3) broken hardware, such as faulty memory
1 and 3 are the most common
what about corruption on a HD
that falls into 2)
It is a laptop
is it only one app that segfaults?
you should run memtest to see if your memory is alright
well, HD corruption is another possibility
there's no way to check "a HD". You need to check the filesystem
fsck is the command for that
right fsck thats what i meant.. Ill have to boot up live cd and do it from there
it might not catch all corruption though. :/
well thats not good
better back up any important data you have as soon as possible.
its my boot drive, no important data there
it might be that the binaries are just corrupted *or* that they have bugs, but if more things start crashing, it's most likely the hardware
in anycase, reinstall the affected software and see if that helps
preferably using apt-get --purge remove (which will remove all configuration as well)
and do an "apt-get clean" first so it'll remove your cached packages
